page.title: 07River Tamar _ Farming
page.content: The{trade}of salmon fishing is carried on here between the months of March and August. Along the river there are licensed, defined{fishing}areas which are overseen by a Water Bailiff (though it is understood that a certain amount of poaching takes place). Authorised{boats}work from Halton Quay, and Hole's Hole, and near Hewton there are salmon gardens where 3ft wide channels are cut to enable fishermen to work at high water. Elsewhere, designated salmon pools are situated where mooring is not allowed but nets may be set. In common with most rivers, fishing as a{leisure} occupation is popular, also the catching of eels is a recent development along this stretch of the river.
